text: while russia's President Vladimir Putin
has made a surprise visit to a Russian
airbase in Syria and ordered a partial
withdrawal of his forces from there
remember Russian military support has
been crucial in turning the tide of the
Syrian conflict and President Assad's
favor let's take you to Steve Rosenberg
following the story for us from Moscow
Steve just tell us more about why
President Putin made the trip there
today you mentioned it was a surprise
visit I suppose the surprise element
isn't so surprising when you consider
the security concerns there must have
been but this was very much a victory
visit President Putin flew into the
Mayman Air Base near Latakia Russia's
main air base in Syria he was met by
President Assad
the two men embraced of course you know
Russia's military operation really the
key to keeping President Assad in power
and helping him be successful in this in
this conflict but he'd come to
congratulate the Russian troops he said
that in just over two years the Russian
army along with the Syrian army had
managed to crush the most battle-ready
part of the international terrorists he
said that the Russian military had
acquitted themselves brilliantly and he
said that he was he'd taken the decision
to send a large part of Russia's
military contingent back home he said
they could now go home to their loved
ones to their friends to their children
and they could go home victorious so a
very upbeat message from the Russian
President to his troops in Syria and
we're seeing pictures of the two
presidents embracing each other talking
very warmly there Steve as they met what
plan is it that Vladimir Putin supports
now in terms of the future of Syria
well Vladimir Putin is talking about a
political solution to two serious
problems he says that the Russian
military operation has laid the
foundations for a political settlement
it should be said of course that Russia
is not withdrawing all of its troops
from Syria the Russians will maintain
two major bases military bases in the
country
as the Khmer Minh airbase where
President Putin was at today but also
Tartus the naval base on the
Mediterranean coast but I think as you
know President Putin talked about
congratulating his troops to an extent
this is very much a victory a personal
victory for Vladimir Putin not only
because Russia has managed to defeat
Isis but also the Russians have managed
to keep in power a key regional Ally
President Assad the Russians
thereby have managed to retain influence
in Syria
they've got military bases in Syria and
also when you step back the Russians
have managed to force world leaders to
deal with Russia because of their
military operation in Syria so I think
many people would see this to a large
extent as a victory for the Kremlin
leader good to see you thanks so much
Steve Steve Rosenberg there in Moss
